intro: Saccolabium clavatum, commonly known as the hairy legume, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss in dry environments. Saccolabium clavatum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
